speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: SCENE V. Dunsinane. Within the castle.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Enter MACBETH, SEYTON, and Soldiers, with drum and colours

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hang out our banners on the outward walls;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The cry is still 'They come:' our castle's strength

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Will laugh a siege to scorn: here let them lie

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till famine and the ague eat them up:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Were they not forced with those that should be ours,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We might have met them dareful, beard to beard,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And beat them backward home.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A cry of women within

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What is that noise?

speaker: SEYTON
text_entry: It is the cry of women, my good lord.

speaker: SEYTON
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I have almost forgot the taste of fears;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The time has been, my senses would have cool'd

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To hear a night-shriek; and my fell of hair

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Would at a dismal treatise rouse and stir

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As life were in't: I have supp'd full with horrors;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Direness, familiar to my slaughterous thoughts

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Cannot once start me.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Re-enter SEYTON

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Wherefore was that cry?

speaker: SEYTON
text_entry: The queen, my lord, is dead.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: She should have died hereafter;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There would have been a time for such a word.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To-morrow, and to-morrow, and to-morrow,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Creeps in this petty pace from day to day

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To the last syllable of recorded time,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And all our yesterdays have lighted fools

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The way to dusty death. Out, out, brief candle!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Life's but a walking shadow, a poor player

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That struts and frets his hour upon the stage

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And then is heard no more: it is a tale

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Told by an idiot, full of sound and fury,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Signifying nothing.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou comest to use thy tongue; thy story quickly.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Gracious my lord,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I should report that which I say I saw,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: But know not how to do it.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Well, say, sir.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: As I did stand my watch upon the hill,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I look'd toward Birnam, and anon, methought,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The wood began to move.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Liar and slave!

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Let me endure your wrath, if't be not so:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Within this three mile may you see it coming;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I say, a moving grove.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If thou speak'st false,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Upon the next tree shalt thou hang alive,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till famine cling thee: if thy speech be sooth,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I care not if thou dost for me as much.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I pull in resolution, and begin

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To doubt the equivocation of the fiend

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That lies like truth: 'Fear not, till Birnam wood

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Do come to Dunsinane:'  and now a wood

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Comes toward Dunsinane. Arm, arm, and out!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If this which he avouches does appear,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There is nor flying hence nor tarrying here.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I gin to be aweary of the sun,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And wish the estate o' the world were now undone.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ring the alarum-bell! Blow, wind! come, wrack!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: At least we'll die with harness on our back.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt
